SEARCH
Package minimax

Class MinimaxAIPlayer

java.lang.Object
minimax.MinimaxAIPlayer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Player
public class MinimaxAIPlayer extends Object implements Player
The MinimaxAIPlayer class represents an AI-controlled player that uses the minimax algorithm to make strategic moves in the game. It extends the Player interface to interact with the game, and calculates moves based on the current board state, game phase, and opponent's position.

  • Constructor Details

    • MinimaxAIPlayer

      public MinimaxAIPlayer(String name, javafx.scene.paint.Color color, Game game, int depth)
      Constructor to initialize the MinimaxAIPlayer with a given name, depth, game, and color.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the AI player.
      color - The color representing the AI player’s pieces on the board.
      game - The game instance for accessing board and opponent information.
      depth - The search depth for the minimax algorithm.

  • Method Details

    • makeMove

      public void makeMove(Board board, int phase)
      Executes the best move calculated by the minimax algorithm for the given board and phase. The method finds the optimal move using minimax and applies it to the board.
      Parameters:
      board - The game board on which the move is to be made.
      phase - The current phase of the game (placement, movement, or endgame).

    • decrementStonesToPlace

      public void decrementStonesToPlace()
      Decreases the number of stones the AI player has to place by one and increments the stones on the board. This is used during the placement phase.
      Specified by:
      decrementStonesToPlace in interface Player

    • incrementStonesOnBoard

      public void incrementStonesOnBoard()
      Increases the number of stones the AI player has on the board by one. This is called when a new stone is added to the board.
      Specified by:
      incrementStonesOnBoard in interface Player

    • decrementStonesOnBoard

      public void decrementStonesOnBoard()
      Decreases the number of stones the AI player has on the board by one. This is typically called when a stone is removed from the board.
      Specified by:
      decrementStonesOnBoard in interface Player
